entry.title: FLEDGE: Provide flexible sub-feature detection
entry.content:
...for now only supporting looking up the value of adComponentsLimit.

It is enabled only when the feature customizing the value is enabled,

and is hidden otherwise, keeping with our goal of not changing

anything web visible by default.



Clients can use something like:

let componentAdLimit = navigator.protectedAudience?.

queryFeatureSupport("adComponentsLimit");

if (!componentAdLimit)

componentAdLimit = 20



Of course additional keywords can be added later



(See https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/810)



Change-Id: Ia5860f28da5bd89ad2b4956eb52e255ffeda6a96

entry.title: Improve IsTypeEnabledForCountry to support legacy requests.
entry.content:
The CL now enables IsTypeEnabledForCountry to handle queries related to

field types within both legacy and newer hierarchies.



Context:



- The IsTypeEnabledForCountry function is primarily used in the

address_field_parser to ensure that newly added field types can function

in their designated countries.

- In scenarios where no custom hierarchy was present, the function

would incorrectly indicate that a field type was unsupported, even if

it belonged to the legacy hierarchy.



Impact of the Change:



This resolves the incorrect behavior and allows

IsTypeEnabledForCountry to accurately process field types from both

legacy and newer hierarchies.



Bug: 1516909

entry.title: [Autofill] Move focus tracking from client to popup controller
entry.content:
This CL replaces the focus-tracking using

WebContentsObserver::OnWebContentsLostFocus() and

WebContentsObserver::OnWebContentsFocused()

with checking RenderWidgetHostView::HasFocus().



At least in Aura, both are apparently equivalent:

The new code uses RenderWidgetHostView::HasFocus(), which is

defined in terms of FocusClient::GetFocusedWindow(), which is

implemented by FocusController and HeadlessFocusClient.

FocusController::GetFocusedWindow() is defined by

FocusController::SetFocusedWindow(), which is where through

FocusChangeObserver::OnWindowFocused() the callpaths of

WebContentsObserver::OnWebContentsFocused() and

WebContentsObserver::OnWebContentsLostFocus() start. Similarly for

HeadlessFocusClient.



I haven't checked for Android (because it goes through JNI) and

Mac (because Obj-C++).



Bug: 1519872

Change-Id: Ic15b0766d480f891da31d69b84af1d69002a61c1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5216871

Commit-Queue: Christoph Schwering

Reviewed-by: Jan Keitel

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1250179}

entry.title: Hide inactive media indicators in PiP
entry.content:
A PiP window has its own PageSpecificContentSettings (PSCS) but

PageSpecificContentSettingsDelegate notifies only the top-frame PSCS.

That means when Camera/Mic permissions are changed, PiP window’s

activity indicators get stale. To fix that,

PageSpecificContentSettingsDelegate should notify PiP window’s PSCS.

from the constructor is causing a crash on Android.

entry.content:
Invoking LayoutManager show when the Hub is already visible (via

TAB_SWITCHER layout type crashes or shows visual artifacts).



Instead the IncognitoReauth backpress handler should return to the

normal tab switcher pane if the "Hub" is visible.



As additional context. Hub is a new "container" for the TabSwitcher it

already supports IncognitoReauth with the same APIs as TabSwitcher

when in the Hub.

entry.title: [iOS][OmniboxPopup] Make cell configuration internally immutable
entry.content:
Make cell configuration internally immutable as intended by the API.

Instead of updating the cell configuration, create a new one with the

updated state.

Quote from UIContentConfiguration method:

/// Returns a copy of the configuration updated for the specified state,

by applying the configuration's default values for that state to any

properties that have not been customized.



This CL:

- Implements copy. (This requires moving the Content View interface)

- Returns a new content configuration when updating for state.

- Actions reference the configuration that created them. When applying a

new configuration to the content view, also update the actions to

avoid retaining the old configuration.



Change-Id: I904b0859c58223bc355fe330808c41b31d29c985

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5216873

entry.title: Move NotificationSuspender to c/b/notifications.
entry.content:
This CL moves the NotificationSuspender (and its native JNI counterpart) from chrome/browser/usage_stats to chrome/browser/notifications. This is in preparation for supporting suspending notifications for reasons other

than digital wellbeing suspensions.



This refactoring removes the NotificationSuspender -> UsageStatsService dependency. The logic for storing new notifications for later (instead of displaying them right away) for digital wellbeing reasons is moved into SuspensionTracker, which is now consulted directly by the NotificationPlatformBridge.

entry.title: Fix rounding of selection for RTL text
entry.content:
We are always rounding the start position of a selection to the left

and the end position to the right, but that's wrong for RTL where the

start is on the right side of the text run and the end is on the left.



It only affects Mac because other platforms always return integer

character positions.



Fix it.

entry.content:
On some platforms, the permission revoking flow done by OTP tracker is not enabled, so the old way of manually triggering is still needed.



Previously failed builder passing: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/try/linux-chromeos-chrome/35315/overview

> [FSA] Fix browser test to expect revoked permission upon tab closure.

>

> With Persistent Permission feature enabled, revoking permission happens

> right away upon tab closure, not after timer is triggered. The existing

entry.title: [//gpu] Remove check for FRAMEBUFFER_HINT + external sampling
entry.content:
[1] restricted the ExternalVkImageBackingFactory short-circuit out when

the SI is using external sampling to short-circuit out only when GL

interop is needed (as specified by the SharedImage usage). We can

further restrict that check: All access with external sampling is

read-only access (in addition to this being generally the case, for GL

in particular it is actually not technically possible to write to SIs

for which external sampling is being done, as there are no driver-side

RGB->YUV conversion APIs exposed), and so the check for

SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_GLES2_FRAMEBUFFER_HINT (which effectively means a

write access) is not relevant here.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5007788



Bug: 1518735

Change-Id: I62e104b5c27af4470d65dd76f00028445011bbef

entry.title: [//gpu] Convert most SI RASTER usage to RASTER_READ | RASTER_WRITE
entry.content:
This CL converts the trivial usages of RASTER_READ in //gpu to

RASTER_READ | RASTER_WRITE.



There are no functional changes, as RASTER is a constant that expands

to RASTER_READ | RASTER_WRITE. This will allow us to subsequently (1)

eliminate RASTER and (2) refine all RASTER_READ | RASTER_WRITE usage

based on where raster reads and writes are actually necessary.

entry.content:
Behavior changes are garded by the kPassExplicitSyncPassphraseToGmsCore

flag.

This change will cause the explicit passphrase to be shared with the

platform client if PasswordStoreAndroidBackend receives a

kPassphraseRequired error. Note: PasswordStoreAndroidBackend is

always queried on startup, so this CL will resolve the passphrase

issue for most users.

entry.title: Add move password footer to the helium bubble details page.
entry.content:
This CL adds a footer in the details page of passwords saved locally.

The footer is only visible if user can currently use butter. When link

in the footer is clicked it will open the "Move password" bubble, but

for now this is not yet implemented and will be part of a followup.



This CL also adds one new and fixes an existing kombucha test.

The issue with the old one was that it was renamed but it's name

wasn't updated in the .filter file. It was passing on the CQ because

of a line that ignores `Screenshot` method failures when screenshot

couldn't have been made(eg. because of a test running on a OS

different than windows).



Mock:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/B5a3SYpLwiabRbe.png

Implementation:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5HfZ4RnhhwqCnNg.png

entry.title: Revert "[FaceGaze] Unhook mouse position and landmark update rates"
entry.content:

Reason for revert: Causing FaceGazeTest flakiness on linux-chroemos



Original change's description:

> [FaceGaze] Unhook mouse position and landmark update rates

>

> Separating the mouse updates from the frame rate will allow the UI

> to feel a bit more snappy even when the frames are lagging.

>

> This supports a possible future in which face landmark updates

> come from a face landmark extension API rather than from within the

> same facegaze extension.

entry.title: Revert "[A11y / FaceGaze]: Don't respond to synthesized events"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 46a323f09644c68bc974fa5ae1ce6e20f6cef9b2.



Reason for revert: Chained cl breaking FaceGazeTest



Original change's description:

> [A11y / FaceGaze]: Don't respond to synthesized events

>

> Upon making the mouse updates faster in crrev.com/c/5207489,

> found that the mouse position callback to Javascript was

> occurring later than the previous mouse position was sent in.

> This is fixed by not sending synthetic mouse events to the

> extensions.

>

> This change also adds a timeout after the last non-synthetic mouse

> move or drag during which FaceGaze doesn't appear to update the

> cursor position; this allows a user to use a mouse or trackpad to

> update their cursor location without it jumping around for half

> a second (500 ms).

>

> Note: Tested that the magnifier still appears to move as expected

> when moving the mouse around after modifying

> accessibility_event_rewriter_delegate_impl, and ChromeVox

> "speak text under the mouse" works with FaceGaze.

>

> Bug: b/317235785

> AX-Relnotes: N/A

> Test: New, existing, manual

> Change-Id: I0086890089e3f66d581c8861364fc259a0a7f3c4

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5212825

> Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

> Commit-Queue: Katie Dektar

entry.title: 🧇 Add country and milestone as keyword DB remerge triggers
entry.content:
Adds new metadata associated with the built-in keywords to the

search engines database: the country for which we loaded the

prepopulated search engines, and the Chrome milestone when that

happened.



This metadata field is updated every time we change the built-in

keyword data on load, but it might trigger re-merges only in

certain cases (e.g. related to the search engine choice feature

state, or the profile being in the EEA).



Bug: b:320461832

entry.content:
On some testing bot, the while loop in testing seems

to take most of the time and the callback of the observer

is not invoked on time, which leads to timeout.



A step_timeout is also added to give a time to the event loop

to invoke the callback from the observer.

entry.title: [gtm] Fix the bug that the tasks view doesn't relayout on child change
entry.content:
Currently the content of the scroll view, which is the tasks container,

doesn't notify the scroll view to see if resizing is possible. This cl

fixes the bug by propagating the preferred size change to the tray

bubble to see if resizing is needed.



This cl also fixes the issue where the scroll view is always

scrollable. This is because when tray bubble view is resizing, it

doesn't consider the child spacing that is specified in box layout.

This cl fixes that by updating the calculation.

entry.title: Rename feature for using PWM FormDataParser predictions.
entry.content:
The name change reflects that

- Signatures are no longer the deciding factor in similarity checks -

PWM's FormDataParser predictions are.

- The feature applies to type overrides in general, not just similarity

checks.



Since the feature is not used in experiments yet, there is no danger

from renaming the feature.

Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8758357091669518465

[ninja://third_party/blink/renderer/controller:blink_unittests/MLGraphTest.Pool2dTest/All.Xnnpack_Async](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fthird_party%2Fblink%2Frenderer%2Fcontroller:blink_unittests%2FMLGraphTest.Pool2dTest%2FAll.Xnnpack_Async?q=VHash%3A8ff0919b88aee026)

entry.title: Revert "Drm blobs: Always specify values"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 130f33760d39964bae83eaf90ab8c9b3f0023e46.



Reason for revert: break screen on ChromeOS devices: b/321609753



Original change's description:

> Drm blobs: Always specify values

>

> Prior to this change, if the specified CTM, GAMMA, or DEGAMMA values

> are empty, then we would set the relevant property to 0 (that is,

> leave them unspecified).

>

> This is a difficulty property to maintain. Rather than maintain it,

> change it so that:

> - an empty CTM causes the CTM to be set to the identity

> - an empty [DE]GAMMA causes [DE]GAMMA to be set to the identity

>

entry.title: Add Clank prompt survey A/B experiment for generic/custom invitations
entry.content:
The A/B experiment is (intentionally) configured within the same finch

group. If enabled and a prompt survey is triggered, a custom survey

invitation is shown with 50% chance, otherwise a generic survey

invitation is shown. The two cases have distinct triggerIds attached,

because if the generic invitation is shown, we need to explain the

context in the first survey question (instead of the invitation).

For that reason, this CL also adds support for dynamically supplied

triggerIDs for a particular trigger to Clank (a feature that is

already support on desktop).



Low-Coverage-Reason: HARD_TO_TEST

entry.title: [CSC] Disallow APIs if self-capturing
entry.content:
Disallow Captured Surface Control APIs while self-capturing. This limits

the potential for abuse. If non-abusive use-cases are discovered later,

the decision to prevent self-capture can be revisited later, subject to

a new Blink intent.



Implementation-wise, the check of self-capture is performed *after* the

check by the permission manager. This means that a prompt may be shown

to the user, and the user might grant permission, and the API calls may

yet be disallowed. This is necessary because the user may use

share-this-tab-instead to switch between self-capture and

non-self-capture at any time, whereas the permission persists throughout

the capture. For that reason:

1. It is necessary to check even if the permission was granted.

2. It is meaningful to prompt the user even if the current API call will

be blocked, because the user might intend to switch tabs and continue

using the permission thereafter.



Applications that wish to avoid prompting the user during self-capture

can do using such existing APIs as Capture Handle, which allows an app

to detect self-capture.



Bug: 1466247

Change-Id: Ie2363980a28ec50202d2de0f635856fe2a2fac45

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5218893

Reviewed-by: Guido Urdaneta

Commit-Queue: Elad Alon

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1250044}

entry.title: [CSC] Fix issues with navigation
entry.content:
Previously, CapturedSurfaceController objects recorded the ID of the

captured page's primary main frame. However, when navigation occurs,

that frame may be replaced.



To fix this issue, we keep a WeakPtr to the captured WebContents,

which remains constant. This is done with care, because that weak

pointer may only be created and referenced on the UI thread,

whereas the CapturedSurfaceController object itself mainly lives

on the IO thread. We keep said WeakPtr as an absl::optional,

which is set to absl::nullopt while awaiting WC-resolution.



One known issue with this approach is that calls to SendWheel()

and SetZoomLevel() might occur while the task to resolve the WC

is pending. These are handled gracefully - the app simply receives

an error. As a follow-up, UMA will be introduced to measure how

often this happens, and whether the problem warrants the increased

code complexity that would be required to solve (or mitigate) it.



Bug: 1466247

Change-Id: Ic186d0df6686f1432c4bb08eea1d15a17ecf69f0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5219251

entry.title: Revert "media/gpu/vaapiWrapper: Scale with VA_FILTER_SCALING_HQ"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 93826fbd7b7f64c87b9fa604e6c562cebce1be5e.



Reason for revert: Quality regression on ADL



Original change's description:

> media/gpu/vaapiWrapper: Scale with VA_FILTER_SCALING_HQ

>

> VA_FILTER_SCALING_HQ achieves better quality than

> VA_FILTER_SCALING_DEFAULT on JSL and no quality changes on ADL.

> This improves the video quality in lower spatial layers in VP9 SVC

> encoding. For example, in 720p L3T1_KEY, the average PSNR is improved

> as follows:

>

> Before After

> L1: 26.7385 28.1604

> L2: 31.2326 33.1460

> L3: 37.5176 37.5178

>

> Bug: b:292195839, b:290863300

> Test: video_encode_accelerator_perf_tests on JSL.

> Test: video_encode_accelerator_tests on JSL.

>

> Change-Id: Ibbe4b5239cba6979d74a4abab63e0807505b73fd

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5172332

> Commit-Queue: Hirokazu Honda

entry.title: [dPWA] Add CrOS user_display_mode sync mitigations for pre-M122 devices
entry.content:
This CL updates CrOS web app installs that add to sync to ensure

the user_display_mode_non_cros field is set to kBrowser in two

scenarios:



- The user_display_mode_cros field is set to kBrowser:

This is because older pre-M122 CrOS devices will sync with the

user_display_mode_non_cros field and default to kStandalone.



- The user_display_mode_cros field is set to kStandalone for

standalone averse web apps (DSS):

Non-CrOS devices will sync install the web apps as kStandalone

by design so we special case these to sync with kBrowser for

non-CrOS instead.



Bug: b/320771282

Design-Doc: go/udm-desync#bookmark=id.cg753kjyrruo

entry.title: Rename `async` to `is_async` in merge_session/background.js
entry.content:
`async` is not a reserved keyword in JS because of backwards

compatibility issues, but it still confuses some modern syntax

highlighters. Rename the variable to `is_async` to avoid any confusion.



Bug: b/315072145

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="*MergeSessionTimeoutTest*"

entry.title: LinkPreview: Add a feature entry at chrome://flags
entry.content:
To explain and give a control for the feature, this patch adds

But we will add multiple modes to switch the trigger operation.

entry.title: Merge sanitizer disabling ifdefs in PDFOCRIntegrationTest.
entry.content:
`PDFOCRIntegrationTest`s are now disabled for sanitizers, and ifdefs are

added per test instance. This makes code a bit less readable, and also

makes rebasing more complicated on other changes that are in progress on

these tests.



To fix the issue, the entire test set is inside one ifdef that covers

the sanitizers.



AX-Relnotes: n/a

Bug: 1516559

entry.title: metrics: Keyboard usage metric
entry.content:
Adds a metric that keeps track of what combination of modifier + keys

people most commonly use. It groups together all alpha and digit keys

into categories so there are no privacy/security concerns. The goal is

to get a metric to see how people utilize their keyboard.



Bug: b/321281982

entry.content:

entry.title: Link Capturing: Default Workspace ARC apps to open links in browser
entry.content:
On Managed devices, ARC apps currently default to link capturing in the

app. This creates a bad experience for Workspace apps, where clicking

any link to Drive/Docs/Sheets/Slides forces open the ARC app.



This CL adds an allowlist to the Managed device link capturing logic to

prevent these apps from being considered for default link capturing.



Bug: b/183661778

Change-Id: I672e24850c7af7f90797dbdeb927cc584b4147c6

entry.title: [Shortstand] Remove WindowMode checks from Link Capturing
entry.content:

windows, meaning WindowMode will be consistent. AppUpdate::WindowMode is

soon to be redundant for web apps.
